csse2002.security

Class ConditionalTwoCoinChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • csse2002.security.ConditionalTwoCoinChannel

  • public class ConditionalTwoCoinChannel
extends java.lang.Object
    Informants may use two-coin channels (see TwoCoinChannel) to communicate information about a Boolean-valued secret to spies.

    In fact, informants -- being omnipotent -- may choose to communicate such a message to a spy based on the current knowledge-state of the spy. (Where, see KnowledgeDistribution, the knowledge-state of the spy is a distribution on the two possible values of the secret, describing the likelihood of either possibility in the spy's current state.)

    This immutable class keeps track of a knowledge-state and a two-coin channel. It is used to describe the condition -- the knowledge-state -- under which an informant will use the aforementioned two-coin channel to communicate to a spy.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConditionalTwoCoinChannel(BigFraction aPriori, TwoCoinChannel c)
      Given a knowledge state ks in which the spy knows the secret is true with probability aPriori (and false with the complement of aPriori), construct a new conditional two-coin channel with knowledge-state ks and two-coin channel c.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BigFraction aPosteriori(boolean output)
      Given that the secret is initially known to be true with probability getCondition() (and false with the remaining probability), this method returns:

      1.
      boolean checkInv()
      Determines whether this class is internally consistent.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Returns true iff o is a ConditionalTwoCoinChannel with such that knowledge-state of o is equivalent to the knowledge-state of this, and the two-coin channel of o is equivalent to the two-coin channel of this.

      (Two knowledge-states are equivalent if they have the same likelihood of the secret being true and false, respectively.)
      BigFraction getCondition()
      Returns the probability that the secret is true in the knowledge-state of this.
      TwoCoinChannel getTwoCoinChannel()
      Returns the two-coin channel that will be used to leak information to the spy if the spy is in knowledge state described by getCondition().
      int hashCode() 
      BigFraction outcomeProbability(boolean outcome)
      Returns the probability that the outcome of the private coin flip will be (outcome? heads: tails) given that the secret is initially known to be true with probability getCondition(), and false with the complementary probability.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns representation of this conditional two-coin channel as the String

      "if true@APRIORI then (C1, C2)"

      where APRIORI is the string representation of this.getCondition(), and (C1, C2) is the string representation of this.getTwoCoinChannel().

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConditionalTwoCoinChannel

        public ConditionalTwoCoinChannel(BigFraction aPriori,
                         TwoCoinChannel c)
        Given a knowledge state ks in which the spy knows the secret is true with probability aPriori (and false with the complement of aPriori), construct a new conditional two-coin channel with knowledge-state ks and two-coin channel c.
        Parameters:
        aPriori - The probability that the secret is true in the knowledge state ks.
        c - The two-coin channel, that will be used to leak information to the spy if the spy is in knowledge state ks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If either argument is null-valued
        InvalidProbabilityException - If aPriori is not a probability

    • Method Detail

      • getCondition

        public BigFraction getCondition()
        Returns the probability that the secret is true in the knowledge-state of this. (That is the knowledge-state that the spy must be in for the informant to leak information to the spy using getTwoCoinChannel().)

      • getTwoCoinChannel

        public TwoCoinChannel getTwoCoinChannel()
        Returns the two-coin channel that will be used to leak information to the spy if the spy is in knowledge state described by getCondition().

      • outcomeProbability

        public BigFraction outcomeProbability(boolean outcome)
        Returns the probability that the outcome of the private coin flip will be (outcome? heads: tails) given that the secret is initially known to be true with probability getCondition(), and false with the complementary probability.

      • aPosteriori

        public BigFraction aPosteriori(boolean output)
        Given that the secret is initially known to be true with probability getCondition() (and false with the remaining probability), this method returns:

        1. BigFraction.ZERO, if the probability of the outcome (outcome? heads: tails) is zero, and

        2. the probability that the secret is true, given that the outcome of the private coin flip is (outcome? heads: tails), otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns representation of this conditional two-coin channel as the String

        "if true@APRIORI then (C1, C2)"

        where APRIORI is the string representation of this.getCondition(), and (C1, C2) is the string representation of this.getTwoCoinChannel().
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true iff o is a ConditionalTwoCoinChannel with such that knowledge-state of o is equivalent to the knowledge-state of this, and the two-coin channel of o is equivalent to the two-coin channel of this.

        (Two knowledge-states are equivalent if they have the same likelihood of the secret being true and false, respectively.)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

        Overrides:

        Determines whether this class is internally consistent.
        Returns:
        true if this class is internally consistent, and false otherwise
